page.title: 12CHANGING TIMES continued
page.content: In the early 1900s a{Church of {Scotland}was built,it was later followed by{Free}and{Free United {Churches,}as by this time because of railway families,the population had increased considerably.{Aviemore Hotel {Farm}in the centre of the village was an important supplier of produce to hotels and villagers.By 1925 Aviemore could boast a PO, 3 shops, 2 garages and 2 bakeries.The 3 classroom {school at nearby Rothiemurchus provided education for 5-14 year olds,the 3Rs forming the curriculum core.In preparation for war,many foreign soldiers underwent{mountain warfare {training}in the area.An original Canadian workshop is still used today as a grocery shop.The council intensified the{housing programme, started in the 30s.At present there are 290 council houses in Aviemore.
